techmeme.title: Mercor, a jobs marketplace that uses AI to vet and interview candidates, raised a $32M Series A led by Benchmark at a $250M valuation and says it's profitable (Alex Konrad/Forbes)
Nintendo and The Pokémon Company sue Pocketpair, accusing the Palworld developer of infringing on "multiple patent rights" (Jay Peters/The Verge)
Court filings: X has moved its official headquarters to Bastrop, Texas, a small town just outside of Austin that's also home to SpaceX and The Boring Company (Sarah Emerson/Forbes)
Playtika agrees to buy Tel Aviv-based mobile game maker SuperPlay for $700M, and up to an additional $1.25B if SuperPlay hits financial targets over three years (Dean Takahashi/VentureBeat)
Sources: the hackers behind the February data breach of drug distributor Cencora received a record ransom of $75M through three bitcoin installments in March (Katrina Manson/Bloomberg)
